alert.note: Alert for Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 8:05PM MDT until August 04 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE MEDIO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTY... At 805 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated the thunderstorms that were producing heavy rain have ended over the Medio Burn Scar. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Forest Road 412, State Road 592, Rio En Medio Road, Rio Nambe downstream to Nambe Pueblo Road 101 and Nambe Reservoir, and Pojoaque Creek to the intersection of State Road 503. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Medio Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Medio Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pojoaque, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Nambe Pueblo, Nambe Lake, Pojoaque Pueblo and Chupadero. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Medio Fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
